intro: Eriope obtusata, commonly known as the broad-leaved eriope, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Eriope obtusata is often found in humid forests and is valued for its ornamental foliage.
